topic.title: TCP/IP settings at Standby Onboard Administrator
topic.keywords: default gateway DNS server dynamic DNS gateway address Onboard Administrator name settings NIC subnet mask TCP/IP settings TCP/IP settings accessed from Standby Onboard Administrator Transmission Control Protocol/Internet Protocol (TCP/IP)

content.p: The Standby Onboard Administrator GUI's TCP/IP Settings screen includes four tabs:

View and modify most settings that can be viewed and modified from the Active Onboard Administrator GUI's Enclosure TCP/IP Settings IPv4 tab. The exception is the Enclosure IP Mode setting. You can view this setting, but you must modify it from the Active Onboard Administrator GUI's Enclosure TCP/IP Settings IPv4 Settings tab.
View and modify most settings that can be modified from the Active Onboard Administrator GUI's Enclosure TCP/IP Settings IPv6 Settings tab, except for the following:
You can view these settings, but you must modify them from the Active Onboard Administrator GUI's Enclosure TCP/IP Settings IPv6 Settings tab.
View and modify the same parameters provided by the Active Onboard Administrator GUI's Enclosure TCP/IP Settings NIC Options tab.
View and modify the same parameters provided by the Active Onboard Administrator GUI's Enclosure TCP/IP Settings Advanced Settings tab.
